==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr}}
From {{etyl|nl|ja|sort=からす'}} {{m|nl|glas}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> The kanji are {{juku|sort=からす'}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|ガラス|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ガラス}}

# {{ja-def|ガラス}} [[glass]] {{qualifier|the material}}

=====Usage notes=====
The kanji form is usually read as {{l|ja|ガラス}}, but is sometimes read as {{l|ja|しょうし}}. The katakana form {{l|ja|ガラス}} is more common.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|玻璃|はり}}: [[crystal]], [[glass]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|しょう|し}}
Appears to be a coinage in Japan from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょうし}}-derived elements, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しょうし|硝|tr1=shō|t1=saltpeter; niter|子|tr2=shi|pos2=diminutive suffix}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|しょうし|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しょうし|hhira=せうし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しょうし|archaic|possibly|_|obsolete}} [[glass]] {{qualifier|the material}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|玻璃|はり}}: [[crystal]], [[glass]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|硝子体|しょうしたい}}: [[vitreous body]]
